intro: Galium tomophyllum, commonly known as the clustered bedstraw, is a low-growing perennial herb native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many shrubs and herbs with small, often fragrant flowers. The plant features slender, sprawling stems that are covered in fine, soft hairs. Its small white or pale pink flowers are arranged in clusters and bloom in late spring to early summer. Galium tomophyllum is typically found in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and stream banks.
